title: New NBA mock draft, two days before Round 1: Latest buzz on the chaotic top-10 picks
content: Will the 76ers, Hornets and Jazz take best-player-available approaches? We project both rounds of the NBA draft.

title: Sources: Celtics trading Holiday to Trail Blazers
content: The Celtics are trading Jrue Holiday to the Trail Blazers for Anfernee Simons and two second-round draft picks, sources told ESPN on Monday night.

title: Haliburton on playing injured: 'I'd do it again'
content: Indiana Pacers star Tyrese Haliburton said he didn't regret playing through a calf strain that led to a torn right Achilles tendon in Game 7.

title: Padres' Tatis sues BLA to void future earnings deal
content: Padres star Fernando Tatis Jr. filed a lawsuit Monday against Big League Advance in an attempt to void the future earnings contract he signed as a 17-year-old minor leaguer that could cost him $34 million.

title: Raleigh hits MLB-leading 32nd HR in Mariners' win
content: Seattle star catcher Cal Raleigh, 28, hit his major-league-leading 32nd home run in the ninth inning of the Mariners' 11-2 victory over the Minnesota Twins on Monday night, just a few hours after being chosen the American League player of the week.

title: Sources: Mavs to extend Gafford on $60M deal
content: Dallas Mavericks center Daniel Gafford intends to sign a three-year contract extension worth nearly $60 million, sources told ESPN.

title: Miami's unbeaten run sets up CWC clash with PSG
content: Palmeiras came from behind to draw 2-2 with host Inter Miami at Hard Rock Stadium on Monday night, with both clubs advancing to the Club World Cup round of 16 and setting up a matchup between Miami and Paris Saint-Germain.

title: D-backs' Carroll headed to IL with wrist fracture
content: Arizona Diamondbacks manager Torey Lovullo told reporters, after his club's 10-0 victory over the Chicago White Sox on Monday night, that star outfielder Corbin Carroll has a chip fracture in his left wrist, and the veteran is headed to the injured list.

title: 'We are Vegas' team': A's begin building stadium
content: The A's on Monday celebrated the groundbreaking of their new $1.75 billion, 33,000-person capacity ballpark in Las Vegas that is expected to be finished in time for the 2028 season.

title: üîÅ Redrafting MLB draft top-10 picks, 2015-24
content: Witt over Rutschman? Does Skenes still go No. 1? Let's go back in time to right the wrongs of the past 10 MLB drafts.

title: Why this Thunder big 3 might be the one to start a dynasty
content: When the Thunder set out to build a champion, they learned hard lessons from how their historic trio of KD, Russell Westbrook and James Harden flamed out a decade ago.

title: How close is your team to an NBA title? We tiered all 30 franchises
content: While the world watched the Finals, the league's hierarchy shifted. Is OKC already looking over its shoulder ?

content: Leo Messi's Inter Miami have made it to the knockouts, where they'll face PSG, while Atletico are the first big team to go home early. Here's what you need to know from Monday's Club World Cup action.

title: Buzz: How Blackhawks, Isles, Predators could shake up first round
content: The first round is Friday. Our reporters pass along the latest intel they're hearing from around the league.

title: 5 things we've learned about the 'freaking awesome' NL West
content: The most dynamic division in baseball has been tons of fun so far. After 17 games in 18 days, here are five lessons.

title: Why 'treatment of families' matters to NFL players -- and where some teams fall short
content: From the Vikings (A+) to the Bengals (F-), we asked players what the expectations are in team treatment of their families.

title: Why empty seats litter Club World Cup, Gold Cup
content: Little more than a week into the summer of soccer, and some of the defining images of the Club World Cup and Gold Cup have been seas of empty seats.

title: Wrexham legend Paul Mullin leaves club on loan
content: Paul Mullin, the poster boy of a Wrexham team soaring through England's football leagues following their takeover by Hollywood celebrities, has left the club to join League One side Wigan on a season-long loan deal.

title: City's Lewis has CWC ban extended by 2 games
content: Rico Lewis will miss Manchester City's next two games at the Club World Cup after his ban was extended following his red card against Wydad AC.

title: Source: Bar√ßa close in on Roony Bardghji transfer
content: Barcelona are close to completing the signing of Copenhagen FC winger Roony Bardghji, a source has told ESPN.

title: Chelsea feel no pressure to win $130M CWC prize
content: Enzo Maresca said Chelsea are not under any financial pressure to lift the Club World Cup despite the ¬£97million on offer to the winner.

title: Sources: Milan's Hern√°ndez nears Al Hilal move
content: Saudi Pro League club Al Hilal are in advanced negotiations with AC Milan to sign Theo Hern√°ndez for a fee close to ‚Ç¨30 million ($34.6m), sources have told ESPN.

title: Poch awed by U.S. leader Tillman: 'What a player'
content: United States manager Mauricio Pochettino said he was pleased to see his team deliver a "professional performance" in defeating Haiti 2-1 in the Concacaf Gold Cup.

title: Jets owner Johnson agrees to buy Palace stake
content: New York Jets owner Woody Johnson has agreed on a ¬£190 million deal ($254m) to buy a 43% stake in Premier League team Crystal Palace from American businessman John Textor, the club announced on Monday.

title: USMNT completes 'perfect' group stage that was anything but
content: Mauricio Pochettino's USMNT made it three-for-three in the Gold Cup group stage, but there is clearly plenty still to work on for the Americans.

title: Grading the deal: Houston goes all-in, but did Phoenix get enough?
content: The Suns and Rockets have agreed to a deal that lands Kevin Durant in Houston. Which side won the trade?

title: Whitcomb, Amihere lead top pickups this week
content: Sami Whitcomb and Laeticia Amihere are positioned to produce for their teams and fantasy managers ahead of a busy week in the WNBA.

title: 2025-26 NBA championship odds: Thunder open as faves ahead of Cavs, Knicks
content: Fresh off their first NBA championship, the Oklahoma City Thunder are favorites to repeat next season.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Casemiro to join Ronaldo at Al Nassr?
content: Manchester United midfielder Casemiro could be reunited with Cristiano Ronaldo at Al Nassr. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Drake Maye marries longtime girlfriend Ann Michael Hudson
content: Maye and Hudson started dating in 2015, with the Patriots quarterback proposing to Hudson in January.

title: Waiver wire: Find someone like Jo Adell?
content: Todd Zola outlines the players you should be claiming off the waiver wire. Rumor has it you should be looking at the Angels outfield.

title: Black box of crashed AI plane not sent abroad, says Naidu; currently with AIIB
content: Civil Aviation Minister K Rammohan Naidu refuted media reports claiming the Air India Ahmedabad crash black box was sent abroad. He confirmed the Aircraft Accident Investigation Bureau (AAIB) is analyzing it in India. The London-bound Boeing 787-8 Dreamliner crashed on June 12, killing 241, and the government formed a panel to investigate the cause.

title: 'All polls held as per law': EC rebuts Rahul; LoP repeats 'voter theft' charge
content: The Election Commission of India (ECI) refuted Rahul Gandhi's rigging allegations in the 2024 Maharashtra polls, asserting adherence to established electoral laws and processes. Despite ECI's clarification and invitation for further discussion, Gandhi persisted with his claims of irregularities, particularly highlighting significant voter list increases in certain constituencies and demanding the release of digital voter rolls and CCTV footage.

title: Diplomatic deja vu: Trump pulls off an India-Pakistan on Israel-Iran; ceasefire 'in effect'
content: US President Donald Trump unilaterally declared a ceasefire between Israel and Iran, a move that surprised even his own administration and the involved nations. Trump claimed both countries sought his intervention for peace. He outlined a detailed ceasefire plan on social media, complete with a timeline, despite ongoing missile exchanges.

title: 8-hour ordeal: Leaky Vande Bharat train roof leaves student drenched; staff say ‚Äòadjust kariye‚Äô
content: Darshil Mishra's Vande Bharat Express journey from Varanasi to Delhi turned disastrous when the train's roof leaked, drenching him and fellow passengers. The onboard staff's dismissive response and the TTE's absence compounded the issue, forcing passengers to endure a humid and uncomfortable ride. The incident, captured on video, sparked outrage online, prompting calls for accountability and improved maintenance.

title: New US Visa rule: Visa applicants to change this setting on FB, Instagram
content: The US embassy in India has announced that applicants for F, M, and J non-immigrant visas must now make their social media accounts public. This new guideline aims to help U.S. officials verify the identity and eligibility of visa applicants during the security screening process. The embassy stated this change is necessary to facilitate vetting and establish admissibility under U.S.

title: ‚ÄòLove triangle or money plot?': Raja's kin seeks narco test on Sonam, lover Raj; brother moves HC
content: Following the murder of Indore businessman Raja Raghuvanshi during his honeymoon in Meghalaya, his family intends to petition the Meghalaya High Court for narco-analysis tests on his wife, Sonam, and her alleged lover, Raj Kushwaha. The family hopes the tests will reveal the unclear motive behind the murder, suspecting financial gain beyond the alleged love triangle.

title: 'You have 12 hours to...': Did Israeli agents warn Iranian generals before strike?
content: Following Israeli airstrikes on Iranian nuclear and military sites, intelligence agents initiated a covert intimidation campaign targeting top Iranian officials. The operation, dubbed "Rising Lion," involved chilling phone calls threatening Iranian generals to defect or face death. This campaign aimed to destabilize Iran's command structure after the elimination of key leaders, creating fear among potential successors.

title: Google cuts $50 million from smart TV team budget, and 75 jobs with it
content: Google has reduced its Google TV and Android TV budget by 10%, leading to layoffs within its smart TV team. This decision aligns with Google's strategic emphasis on YouTube, which boasts substantial advertising and subscription revenue.

title: Watch: Chaos erupts at music festival in Paris after mysterious syringe attacks
content: French authorities arrested twelve individuals accused of syringe attacks at a nationwide music festival, with approximately 145 people reporting needle pricks across the country, including 13 in Paris. Investigations are underway to determine if the syringes contained date rape drugs.

title: Adani Group to put $15-20 bn across businesses over 5 years
content: Gautam Adani announced a $15-20 billion investment plan over the next five years, aiming to fuel the Adani Group's growth across its diverse infrastructure portfolio.

title: Indian Railways hikes fares of trains; minor increase in ticket prices from July 1
content: Indian Railways is set to hike passenger train fares for the first time in several years. The minor increase in fares will be effective from July 1, 2025. Earlier this month, Indian Railways made a significant announcement requiring Aadhaar authentication for tatkal train ticket bookings.

title: Elon Musk‚Äôs simple life: World‚Äôs richest says will never own 5 things
content: Elon Musk, despite his immense wealth, maintains a surprisingly minimalist lifestyle. He sold numerous properties, opting for a small Boxabl home and even crashing at friends' places. Musk once lived on $1 a day and famously crashed a McLaren, never replacing it, showcasing his detachment from luxury possessions and focus on his ventures.

title: 'Mahi bhaiya...': MS Dhoni playing with a former teammates' son - Watch
content: Former India cricketer Saurabh Tiwary shared a heartwarming video on Facebook featuring MS Dhoni playfully interacting with his son, Sourish, in a gym. Tiwary, who debuted for India under Dhoni in 2010, recently transitioned to administration, being elected as secretary and joint secretary of the Jharkhand State Cricket Association after retiring from professional cricket last year.

title: Gulf tensions: Multiple flights disrupted across India; airlines issue alert
content: Flight operations at Delhi's IGI Airport faced major disruptions with 48 cancellations, impacting Air India and IndiGo significantly. Airports across India, including Ahmedabad, Thiruvananthapuram, and Mangaluru, experienced delays due to airspace restrictions over Qatar and the Gulf region. Cochin and Lucknow airports issued advisories amid heightened Middle East tensions following Iran's missile strike on U.S. bases in Qatar and Iraq.

title: Stock market rally: Investors richer by Rs 5 lakh crore - top reasons
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, soared in trade on Tuesday after Donald Trump announced a ceasefire between Iran and Israel.

title: Will PPF rate fall below 7%? Public Provident Fund rate could hit 50-year low
content: Will Public Provident Fund (PPF) rate fall below 7% for the first time in decades, influenced by the Gopinath Committee formula and fluctuating 10-year government bond yields? Despite the possibility of a rate cut, PPF remains an attractive investment due to its tax-free interest, especially compared to taxable bank deposits and capped Voluntary Provident Fund contributions.

title: IND vs ENG: Ashwin comments on Jaiswal's catching; wants Jadeja to step up
content: R. Ashwin defended Yashasvi Jaiswal's slip catching in England, citing the Dukes ball's difficulty and urging patience. He highlighted the ball's larger feel compared to SG and Kookaburra. Ashwin also suggested Indian pacers create rough patches for Ravindra Jadeja to exploit, drawing inspiration from how foreign teams aid their spinners. He emphasized the importance of spin for India's chances.

title: Dwyane Wade‚Äôs daughter steals spotlight dancing in white lehanga
content: A delightful Instagram video of Kaavia James, daughter of Dwyane Wade and Gabrielle Union, has captured hearts globally. The six-year-old is seen joyfully dancing to the Bollywood hit ‚ÄúWhat Jhumka?‚Äù while dressed in a traditional white lehenga. The heartwarming clip, posted by her parents, celebrates cultural exploration and youthful exuberance.

title: BJP alleges Rahul Gandhi on 'secret' foreign trip; Congress hits back
content: The Congress party defended Rahul Gandhi's trip to London for his niece's graduation after BJP's Amit Malviya criticized his frequent foreign travels and demanded transparency. Congress spokesperson Pawan Khera accused the PMO of dirty tricks, confirming Gandhi's attendance at Miraya Vadra's graduation.

title: 'She‚Äôs heartbroken': Blake Lively breaks down as Taylor Swift cuts ties
content: The friendship between Blake Lively and Taylor Swift has ended. Sources say Lively is heartbroken after Swift cut ties. Legal issues involving Justin Baldoni's case add complexity. Lively must submit texts with Swift. Rumors suggest Lively tried to leverage her Swift connection. Travis Kelce supports Swift during this difficult time. Swift's upcoming album may reflect themes of betrayal.

title: FWICE calls for boycott of Diljit Dosanjh,'Sardaarji 3' makers; urge PM Modi for action
content: The Federation of Western India Cine Employees (FWICE) has strongly condemned Diljit Dosanjh and the makers of ‚ÄòSardaarji 3‚Äô for casting Pakistani actress Hania Aamir, alleging she is 'anti-India'. FWICE has appealed to PM Modi for immediate action, urging a ban on the film's release in India and demanding the revocation of the filmmakers' passports.

title: Raj dig uncovers 3,500-yr-old site: ASI traces riverbed; findings link it to Saraswati river
content: In the heart of Rajasthan's Deeg district, archaeologists from the ASI have stumbled upon an ancient palaeochannel that may connect to the legendary Saraswati river. Recent excavations in Bahaj village have revealed settlements dating back to 3500-1000 BC, showcasing relics from the Kushan, Magadha, and Sunga dynasties.

title: Iran-Israel conflict: Trump declares ceasefire 'now in effect'; warns against violations
content: Amidst the Iran-Israel conflict, Donald Trump declared a ceasefire, which Iran promptly denied. Despite the denial, Iran confirmed its military operations ceased at 4 am Tehran time, following missile strikes on a US base in Qatar in response to attacks on its nuclear facilities. Tensions remain high as Iran's Supreme Leader asserts the nation's resilience.

title: IND vs ENG: Pant reprimanded by ICC - why has he been punished?
content: Rishabh Pant has been reprimanded by the ICC for breaching the Code of Conduct during the Headingley Test against England. Pant showed dissent at an umpire's decision regarding the condition of the ball, leading to a demerit point on his record. Despite this incident, Pant had an outstanding batting performance, scoring two centuries in the match.

title: 'Molested & beat me': Woman groped, assaulted near Bengaluru
content: In Bengaluru's outskirts, a 26-year-old woman faced sexual harassment and assault by a group, leading to public outrage after videos surfaced. Police detained John Richard and his father, Kanikya Swamy, following complaints from both sides. The incident occurred when John, allegedly intoxicated, accosted the woman with lewd comments, escalating into a physical assault.

title: S&P raises India‚Äôs GDP growth forecast to 6.5%, despite fragile global situation
content: S&P Global Ratings anticipates India's economy will grow 6.5% this fiscal year. This revision considers normal monsoon and lower crude oil prices. Global uncertainties and Middle East unrest pose risks.

title: Gold rate today: Prices drop below Rs 97,000 per 10 grams- what‚Äôs the outlook?
content: Gold prices plummeted on MCX after a reported ceasefire announcement between Iran and Israel, with August futures dropping by approximately 3% to Rs 96,422/10 grams. Silver also declined, while both metals had previously gained due to Middle East tensions.

title: Char Dham Yatra: Landslides wreak havoc on Badrinath routes
content: Tragedy struck Uttarakhand's Char Dham pilgrimage as landslides triggered by heavy rainfall claimed three lives and left one missing. On the Yamunotri route, falling boulders killed two pilgrims, while another remains missing. A separate incident on the Badrinath highway resulted in the death of a woman after a rock struck her car.

title: Donald Trump hits out at US Fed Chair Jerome Powell; calls him ‚Äòdumb, hardheaded person‚Äô
content: US President Donald Trump has intensified his criticism of Fed Chairman Jerome Powell, labeling him 'incompetent' for not lowering interest rates. Despite economists' fears, inflation has remained subdued, even with Trump's tariffs.

title: IND vs ENG: 'You know what...,' Gavaskar reveals outlandish plans after Pant's century
content: Rishabh Pant etched his name in cricket history by scoring centuries in both innings of the first Test against England, becoming only the second wicketkeeper-batter to achieve this feat. Pant's new eye-pointing celebration replaced his trademark somersault, drawing questions from commentators. His performance, along with KL Rahul's century, set England a target of 371.

title: Nutritionist sheds 30kg in 8 months: Skips gym entirely; follows 10 simple rules
content: Udita Agarwal, an Indian nutritionist, shed 30 kg in 8 months without hitting the gym, relying on consistent, small lifestyle changes. Udita never made it about numbers or crash goals. Her weight loss was slow, intentional, and built on habits that can be followed for life. Her story is now followed by thousands online‚Äînot for gym routines or celebrity diets, but for how real and relatable her journey is.

title: Moments after attack: Scenes of panic unfold in Doha mall after Iranian missile strikes - watch
content: Iran retaliated against US forces at Al Udeid Airbase in Qatar. This followed US strikes on Iranian nuclear sites. Explosions occurred in Doha and Lusail. Qatar closed its airspace. Iran claimed it targeted areas away from Qatari cities. Strikes also hit US bases in Iraq. These events followed Israeli strikes on Iranian nuclear facilities.

title: Health scare mid-air: 11 fall ill on Air India London-Mumbai flight; food poisoning suspected
content: An Air India flight AI-130 from London to Mumbai faced a mid-air scare as several passengers and crew members reported feeling dizzy and nauseated. While initial reports suggested 11 were affected, Air India confirmed that five passengers and two crew members experienced discomfort.

title: Himachal Pradesh school teacher arrested for sexually harassing 24 girls; touched students inappropriately
content: In Himachal Pradesh's Sirmaur district, a government school teacher has been arrested following allegations of sexually harassing 24 girl students. The accused, a mathematics teacher, was taken into custody after the students reported the incidents. Promptly, the education department suspended him, initiating an inquiry. A women‚Äôs rights group protested, highlighting increasing sexual assault cases involving teachers.

title: Woman finds 2.69 carat diamond; mining office awaits auction
content: After two years of relentless searching, a financially struggling woman discovered a 2.69-carat diamond in a private mine located in the Panna district. She has deposited the precious gem with the local mining office, initiating the standard auction process. Following the auction, she will receive the proceeds after deductions for royalty and taxes, marking a significant turn in her fortunes.

title: Iran-Israel conflict: Govt says airlines compelled to cancel or reroute flights
content: Due to escalating Middle East tensions and airspace closures, Indian carriers are canceling or rerouting flights, according to Union Minister Ram Mohan Naidu. The Ministry of Civil Aviation is closely monitoring the situation and coordinating with airlines to minimize passenger disruption. IndiGo has suspended flights to several Middle Eastern destinations, while Emirates rerouted flights on June 23.

title: IND vs ENG Test: 'It is hard for us to understand...,' KL Rahul on Pant
content: KL Rahul has defended Rishabh Pant's aggressive batting style after his remarkable performance in the first Test against England, where he became the first Indian wicketkeeper to score two centuries in a match. Pant's aggressive innings helped India set a target of 371 for England.

title: Trump makes new claim on ceasefire; Tehran says he 'begged for it'
content: Donald Trump asserted that Israel and Iran approached him seeking peace "almost simultaneously." This declaration followed his announcement of a U.S.-proposed ceasefire accepted by both nations to end their recent conflict. Trump expressed optimism for their future, envisioning "tremendous love, peace and prosperity" if they maintain a path of "RIGHTEOUSNESS & TRUTH."

title: 'Fight against violent extremism': Canadian PM Carney on Air India Kanishka bombing
content: Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney marked the 40th anniversary of the Air India Flight 182 bombing, calling it Canada's deadliest terrorist attack. He reaffirmed Canada's commitment to fighting terrorism, echoing sentiments shared by opposition leader Pierre Poilievre. A memorial event in Ireland saw participation from Canadian, Indian, and Irish officials, emphasizing the need for international cooperation against terrorism.

title: Axiom-4: Nasa shares update; India's Shubhanshu Shukla targets liftoff tomorrow
content: Nasa has confirmed that the Axiom Mission 4 (Ax-4) to the International Space Station is now scheduled for launch on June 25, following earlier delays. Indian Air Force pilot Shubhanshu Shukla, representing Isro, will be the mission pilot, making him the second Indian in space after Rakesh Sharma. He will be accompanied by astronauts from Poland and Hungary.

title: Adani raises $1 billion for Mumbai Airport expansion from global investors
content: Adani Airports Holdings Ltd. (AAHL) has secured $1 billion in financing for Mumbai International Airport (MIAL) through a project finance structure. This includes issuing $750 million in notes for refinancing and a provision to raise an additional $250 million. The funds will support MIAL's capital expenditure program for development and modernization.

title: IND vs ENG: Pant equals Sachin's record, now only behind Rahul Dravid
content: Rishabh Pant made twin centuries at Headingley Test. He became the first Indian to score centuries in both innings of a Test in England. Pant joined India‚Äôs twin centuries club. His consistency in England earned him a special place. Pant equalled the record for the most sixes in a Test in England. The Headingley Test was historic for India.

title: 'He bowled to me in the nets': Tendulkar‚Äôs emotional tribute to Dilip Doshi will leave you teary-eyed
content: Former India left-arm spinner Dilip Doshi passed away in London at the age of 77 due to cardiac arrest. Sachin Tendulkar paid tribute, recalling their first meeting in 1990. Doshi played 33 Tests, taking 114 wickets, and was a stalwart in English county cricket, also representing Bengal and Saurashtra in the domestic circuit.

title: IND vs ENG: 'Straight ball hai, theke?';Pant‚Äôs self-check moment - Watch
content: Rishabh Pant dazzled in the first Test against England, showcasing his audacious talent. He scored a masterful century in each innings, becoming the first Indian to achieve this feat in England. Pant's innovative shots and candid self-talk, captured by stump mics, entertained fans.

title: IND vs ENG: My Test avg hurts, but I don‚Äôt chase numbers now'- KL Rahul
content: Rahul's magnificent century, his sixth in SENA countries, combined with a crucial partnership with Rishabh Pant, propelled India to a commanding position in the opening Test against England. India set a daunting target of 371, fueled by strong batting performances throughout the innings.

title: Israel-Iran conflict: Indigo issues travel advisory; says 'considering safest flight paths'
content: Following escalating tensions in the Middle East, Indigo has issued a travel advisory, suspending flights to and from several destinations including Dubai, Doha, and Riyadh until at least 1000 hours. The airline is closely monitoring the situation and considering the safest flight paths, prioritizing passenger safety amidst regional unrest.

title: Telangana govt integrating AI into TG-iPASS industrial system to enhance transparency, speed of approval
content: The State IT and Industries Minister mentions this to visiting French delegation, urging its members to explore growth opportunities in Telangana‚Äôs ambitious Future City project¬†¬†

title: PM Modi's 'silence' on Israel's 'genocide' in Gaza has diminished India's moral, political standing: Congress
content: Congress criticises PM Modi‚Äôs silence on Israel‚Äôs Gaza ‚Äògenocide‚Äô, urging India to speak out against the devastation in West Asia

title: DG Intelligence Shivdhar Reddy receives award on behalf of Telangana police for VeriFast app
content: The award was presented in New Delhi by Minister of State for External Affairs, Pabitra Margherita on the occasion of Passport Seva Divas

title: All polls held as per law: ECI tells Rahul on Maharashtra poll rigging allegations
content: It also emphasised that the entire poll exercise involves thousands of personnel, including booth-level agents appointed by political parties.

title: Ahead of local body polls, Jana Sena puts special focus on north Andhra districts
content: The party is hopeful that it would get a sufficient number of ZPTC and MPTC seats in future although it was given only two Assembly seats in the general elections.

title: Tribal Ministry urged to delete 'Any Kuki Tribes' category from Manipur's ST list
content: ‚ÄòThe vague nature of ‚ÄòAny Kuki tribes‚Äô allows foreigners to claim tribal rights in Manipur, which poses a serious threat to land, resources, and constitutional privileges of pre-existing scheduled tribes,‚Äô says Meitei Alliance

title: BJP demands Karnataka CM‚Äôs resignation over corruption charges by Congress MLAs
content: BJP State president B. Y. Vijayendra terms this as ‚ÄòState-sponsored corruption‚Äô and demands that Governor Thaawarchand Gehlot intervene if CM does not quit

title: Search operation underway in Jammu and Kashmir‚Äôs Poonch
content: Security forces conduct search operation in Jammu and Kashmir‚Äôs Poonch district following suspicious movement, covering multiple areas

content: He hinted at the AIADMK having severed ties with the BJP in the past when similar defamatory statements were made against leaders of Dravidian parties

title: Nilambur bypoll: IUML leader M.K. Muneer says never had any pact with Jamaat or Welfare Party of India
content: Muneer says IUML and Jamaat ‚Äòwould not get along well with each other because of their ideological differences‚Äô

title: U.P. govt. to give ‚Çπ30 lakh each to families of two sanitation workers who died inhaling toxic gas
content: The U.P. government compensation is announced based on the minimum amount mandated by the Supreme Court

title: Search for two more persons resumes after landslip hits Yamunotri trek route in Uttarakhand
content: Search and rescue operations resume after landslip near Kainchi Bhairav Mandir, with one rescued and two bodies recovered; Gangotri Dham yatra halted temporarily

title: Defence Ministry clears ‚Çπ2,000 crore contracts under emergency procurement for counter-terror operations
content: The procurement aims to enhance situational awareness, lethality, mobility, and protection for troops deployed in CT environments

title: Marathi language being 'insulted': Sanjay Raut on govt meetings over 3-language policy
content: Sanjay Raut also questioned the "silence" of prominent Marathi literary figures and celebrities, and claimed many of them were not vocal on the issue due to their association with the government

content: What was the convict‚Äôs modus operandi? How did the women helpline 181 respond? Were the police sensitive enough? Did the court accept the claim of alibi?

title: 61-year-old Kerala doctor arrested in POCSO case for allegedly molesting teen during counselling
content: The incident occurred in December 2023 when the girl, now 16, visited the doctor‚Äôs house for counselling with her parents. She disclosed the abuse during a school counselling session this year

title: At SCO Defence Ministers‚Äô meet in Qingdao, Rajnath likely to discuss regional peace, anti-terror cooperation
content: Rajnath Singh will hold bilateral meetings with the Defence Ministers of some participating countries, including China and Russia, on the sidelines of the meeting.

title: Student enrollment drop in Kota: Local economy struggles, coaching marketing intensifies
content: Kota‚Äôs student enrolments decline, impacting local businesses and prompting desperate marketing strategies.

title: India evacuates fresh batch of 292 Indians from Iran
content: A C-17 military transport aircraft of the Indian Air Force evacuated 165 Indians who were living in Israel. They were received at the airport by Union Minister L Murugan.

title: Telangana tops India in child labour rescues, arrests: Report
content: The report ‚ÄúBuilding the Case for Zero‚Äù calls for district-level child labour task forces, universal free and compulsory education up to the age of 18, and a zero-tolerance policy for the use of child labour in public procurement and supply chains

title: V.S. Achuthanandan remains in ICU, condition stable, says family
content: In a Facebook post, Achuthanandan‚Äôs son, V. Arun Kumar, says his father was admitted to the hospital on Monday after the centenarian experienced ‚Äòmild‚Äô breathing difficulties¬†

title: West Asia tensions disrupt flights from Kannur airport in Kerala, Gulf-bound passengers hit
content: Passengers are advised to check the latest status of their flights with their respective airlines before proceeding to the airport, says Kannur International Airport Limited

title: Kerala High Court dismisses petitions against Kerala Clinical Establishments Act
content: Court rules that nothing in the Act seemed arbitrary or a violation of the Constitution, as the Act clearly gives opportunities for the clinical establishments for a hearing before the authorities can take dire steps against a clinical establishment

title: No fund crunch but bureaucratic delay, says Union Minister Gadkari on execution of big projects
content: During an event in Pune, Mr. Gadkari heaped praise on former bureaucrat Vijay Kelkar for his ‚Äòflexibility in policy-making‚Äô

title: Keralites in West Asia share their anxiety
content: Keralites share their experiences during Iranian missile attack in Qatar and Bahrain, causing panic and evacuations

title: Linguist calls for cultural unity among speakers of Dravidian languages
content: Linguist Ganesh Devy emphasised the need for unity among the Dravidian language-speaking States of the south to launch a collective resistance against Hindi imposition

title: Meghalaya BJP leader seeks viewpoint named after Raja Raghuvanshi
content: James Syiemiong says the memorial for the slain Indore businessmen would be a symbolic landmark for tourism and awareness in Sohra

title: Lobbying begins as date notified for mayoral polls in Hubballi-Dharwad
content: The stage is set for electing a new mayor and a deputy mayor with the Regional Commissioner fixing June 30 as the date for elections

title: Ceasefire That Isn't? Israel Orders "Powerful Strikes" After Iran Rains Missiles

content: The legacy of one of ancient Egypt's most successful rulers, a rare female pharaoh who preceded Cleopatra by 1,500 years, was systematically erased by her stepson successor after her death.

content: Asserting that Operation Sindoor has made clear to the world India's stringent policy against terrorism, Prime Minister Narendra Modi said on Tuesday that his government takes whatever steps are appropriate in national interest.

content: Popular Tamil and Telugu film actor Srikanth has been remanded to judicial custody till July 7th by a Chennai court in connection with a cocaine-related case.

content: The airspaces over Qatar, the UAE, and Bahrain were closed on Monday night after Iran launched a missile attack on US military bases in Qatar in retaliation for the American strikes.

content: Jury members in the trial of an Australian woman accused of murdering three relatives with a toxic mushroom-laced meal were warned Tuesday to cast aside any "prejudice and sympathy".

title: Unemployed youth move Bombay High Court over delayed induction¬†despite appointment letter
content: Sumedh Shivaji Jadhav, a qualified youth from Sindhudurg, has approached the Bombay High Court after being denied joining despite receiving a government-backed job appointment. His petition highlights bureaucratic inaction and seeks urgent redress for months of unemployment.¬†

title: IIT Bombay scientists develop solar heat battery for freezing Himalayan homes¬†
content: Researchers at IIT Bombay have developed a solar-powered thermochemical battery using strontium bromide that can store summer heat and release it in freezing Himalayan winters. The system offers a clean, cost-effective alternative to diesel heating in remote, high-altitude regions.

title: Fantasy: How Haliburton's injury impacts Pacers
content: the Pacers could see the biggest shift in fantasy value for 2025-26 . in eight games without Haliburton this past season, Nembhard averaged 11.3 points, 2.6 rebounds and 6.6 assists . his 28.9 minutes per game in 2024-25 was a career high for the third-year pro out of Gonzaga .

title: Jones known for being great, not fighting Tom Aspinall

"when we go to work every day, we do it trying to make the Tigers that came before us proud," says a designated hitter .
